result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R Petrie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua R Petrie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua R Petrie was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Joshua R Petrie was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for ZERO days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: *COURT ORDERED ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARES WAIVED IN COUNT ONE DUE TO LOW INCOME.

*NO CONTACT WITH ANY SPEEDWAYS OR PICK N SAVES
*NO NEW RETAIL THEFT TICKETS

*REFERRED TO MENTAL HEALTH UNIT
*TAKE ALL PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 probation conditions apply.
Credit for ZERO DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: PAY ALL MANDATORY COST, FEES AND SURCHARGES DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R Petrie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT TWO:   

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for  ZERO DAYS  time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS SAME AS COUNT ONE, EXCEPT COURT ORDERED ALL MANDATORY COST, FEES AND SURCHARGES DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT.  

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO:   Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT THREE:  DISMISSED.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT ONE:   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO  days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
*REFERRED TO MENTAL HEALTH UNIT 
*TAKE ALL PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS
*NO CONTACT WITH ANY SPEEDWAYS OR PICK N SAVES
*NO NEW RETAIL THEFT TICKETS
*COURT ORDERED ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARES WAIVED IN COUNT ONE DUE TO LOW INCOME.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
On motion of the State, Court set bail in the amount of $100.00 cash with TOT to Justice point for monitoring.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties in receipt of doctor's report indicating that the defendant is now competent to proceed. All parties stipulate to the findings. Court orders proceedings reinstated.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Report from WCS dated 09/14/2015 regarding the defendant's transportation status received and filed.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 9 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. Court ordered involuntary medication for the defendant.   The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 9 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-24-15  at 8:30 a.m. for review hearing  in Branch 47.  Review hearing scheduled for 11-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report which is inconclusive, defendant was uncooperative with the forensic doctor. Court ordered defendant to be transported by the Sheriff's Dept.  to Mendota for an inpatient evaluation . Defendant remains remanded into the custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. 
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 08-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report.  Defense is challenging the report. Court called Dr. Pankiewicz and scheduled a competency hearing. 
  Competency hearing scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit . Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 47. Defendant remanded into custody.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and FIled, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; Missed Office Contact.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: ANY Speedway Convenience Store in Milwaukee County.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
